Although he was far from lonely, thanks to the sheer number of women surrounding him, Mark often felt overwhelmed. His intelligence gave him an advantage in understanding complex technology and solving problems. However, no amount of critical thinking skills could prepare him for the unique challenges of living in Vault 91.

Vault life tended to follow a fairly standardized routine. Each morning, Mark was greeted by a gaggle of enthusiastic women, all eager to help him get ready for the day. He could hardly step out of his living quarters without being showered with attention. His clothes were meticulously selected and prepared, his meals were lovingly crafted, and conversations about Vault life were laced with affection and concern for his well-being.

Mark often found himself wondering what Vault-Tec had envisioned for the original test subjects. Likely the towering women were meant to intimidate and control the weaker men, but the reality was far from that. Instead, the women of Vault 91 operated in a state of near-constant excitement and affection, with the handful of men as the focal point for all their energy. While they were physically superior, their impaired critical thinking meant that their emotions were almost childlike in their intensity.

Mark navigated the hallways, surrounded by smiling faces and the warm, inviting presence of his female vault dwellers. It wasn't uncommon for someone to scoop him up in a bear hug, showering him with kisses and affectionate pats on the head. While the women's intentions were innocent, and their actions prompted by the drugs administered long ago, it could be an exhausting experience for Mark and the few other men in the vault.

In the dimly lit library, Mark found solace in the company of books. Reading was one of the few activities that allowed him to disconnect from the overwhelming social interactions of Vault 91. As he immersed himself in a pre-war novel, he contemplated whether there was more to life than this strange existence. The Overseer controlled the vault operations, and Mark's role was primarily to support her by utilizing his intelligence.

As Mark lost himself in the library, Jennifer, one of the tallest and most affectionate women, found him immersed in his book. Excitedly, she wrapped her arms around him, causing the book to fly out of his hands.

"Mark! You won't believe what I found in the hydroponics lab today! I discovered a new way to harvest potatoes quickly," she gleefully proclaimed, her enthusiasm infectious. Mark, while grateful for her help in maintaining the food supply, could not help but become exasperated by her constant interruptions.

Jennifer, like so many others in Vault 91, genuinely cared for Mark and wanted to help him in any way possible. But in their eagerness to please and their reduced critical thinking capabilities, the women rarely stopped to consider if their actions were actually beneficial.

Jennifer continued blabbering about potatoes and the hydroponics lab as Mark attempted to reclaim his book. The library, once a safe haven, was now transformed into yet another space where he felt the strain of Vault 91's unique social dynamic. As the day drew to a close, Mark returned to his living quarters, reflecting on the bizarre life in Vault 91.

The residents of Vault 91 lived in a world shaped by the experiments of Vault-Tec. Taller, stronger women who bubbled with affection and a craving for attention coexisted with physically weaker, intelligent men. While physical domination never played out as originally intended, Vault 91 evolved a new social structure shaped by the drugs administered to their ancestors. An unyielding human spirit prevailed, even in such an unnatural existence. Regrettably for Mark and the other men, however, that unyielding spirit also took the form of dozens of women who had not yet learned the value of personal space.

Chapter 1: A Life of Limitless Possibilities

Vault 91 was different, that much my parents ensured I knew; they taught me all about the strange experiment that set us apart from the other vaults. I was one of the rare males born in this peculiar society, with hundreds of large and strong, yet adoring women surrounding me. It was said that with each generation, women had not only grown taller and stronger but had also become increasingly affectionate and devoted to us men. Given my own experience, I guessed the stories to be true.

I was still in my teens, but already I stood at four feet—considered towering among my male peers. My parents, both respected members of the Vault's ruling council, had brought me up with strong moral values and a sense of responsibility. And now, with the wisdom of generations' worth of slightly smarter men whispering in my ears, I strode with purpose through the bustling marketplace of Vault 91.

The structure was colossal, with its shimmering metal walls reverberating the voices and laughter of dozens of women, each engrossed in their own activity. I weaved through huddles of mothers, daughters, and sisters, all wearing the protective blue suits designed specifically for them. They effortlessly carried massive bags of supplies, laughing and chattering with unbounded enthusiasm. At times, the marketplace took on an overwhelming atmosphere but never did it feel hostile—rather, it pulsed with the vibrant rhythm of life.

Beneath the cacophony of market chatter, I could often hear whispers of awe and admiration whenever I passed by. "Look, it's a man," they'd say, their faces lighting up with smiles. I hated the attention, but I reminded myself of the responsibility that came with my genetic fortune.

I soon reached a quieter part of Vault 91, the dimly lit corridor leading to the council chambers. My father, who had recently passed away, used to serve as one of the wisest council members. Now, as one of the few remaining men in the Vault, the responsibility had fallen on my shoulders. In his last moments, my father had taught me an important lesson — the world needed balance, and it was up to us men to guide our female counterparts using our intellect.

The council chamber was an impressive sight—a large, circular room with a massive oak table at its center. As I entered, the other councilmen, all older and wiser than me, greeted me with warm smiles and encouraging words. Seated at the table were a group of women, eagerly awaiting our input on various matters.

The days in Vault 91 flowed like clockwork, but the peculiarities of our existence never seemed to fade. Each morning, I would wake up and pop the pills prescribed to me by the Mister Orderlies, their metallic arms effortlessly dispensing the small round tablets. The purpose of these pills was hidden from us, but speculation brewed in hushed conversations. Some claimed they were designed to suppress our growth, while others insisted they were solely for health purposes. I'd always swallowed the pills without a second thought— whatever they did, it was clear it benefitted us in some way.

Despite our seemingly uninterrupted peace and harmony, the lingering unease in the distant corners of the Vault served as a constant reminder of the fears, hopes, and desires of those who had come before us. It was a testament to the twisted world above, where fire and ruin once reigned, and a warning that the frail balance of Vault 91 could one day shatter under the weight of unforeseen circumstances.

As I sat at the table, contemplating the immense responsibility that life had thrust upon me, I found solace in the thought that, in Vault 91, we had defied the unnatural experiment that had been designed for us. We had overcome the external manipulation and built a thriving society that celebrated both the unyielding strength of the women and the sharp intellect of the men.

As a new councilman serving a delicate balance of power in Vault 91, I embraced the opportunity to shape a better future for all the people who called this place home—man or woman, strong or intelligent. The lessons of the past, and the hope for a future never guaranteed, now rested on my weary shoulders. The life of limitless possibilities stretched before me, and in the depths of the Vault, the faintest glimmers of a brighter tomorrow began to shine.

具体The后面加什么词性？

"The" 通常在英语中用作冠词或限定词，一般放在单数或复数名词前面以表示特定或已知的东西或人。因此，后面通常加名词。例如：

- The cat (限定词+名词)
- The book (限定词+名词)
- The sun (限定词+名词)
- The teacher (限定词+名词)

当然，在其他情况下，你也可以在 "The" 后面加上名词短语，如：

- The girl with the red hair (限定词+名词短语)
- The man in the suit (限定词+名词短语)
- The restaurant near the station (限定词+名词短语)

注意，总的来说， "The" 通常与名词或名词短语一起使用，而不是其他词性的单词。

平行四边形的对角线是角平分线。

因为平行四边形的对角线是对边之间的连线，对角线所在的两个三角形中，每个三角形的两个角是一个平行四边形的相邻角，所以对角线将每个角分成两个相等的角，从而成为角平分线。
感叹句how与what的区别？

在英语中，"how" 和 "what" 都可以用作感叹句，但它们在语法上有一些不同之处，它们强调的内容也不同。

"How" 感叹句通常强调了一种方式或方法，或者强调某种情感或心情。例如：

- How amazing the concert was! (感叹式强调了演唱会的惊人之处)
- How kind of you to offer help! (感叹式强调了对方提供帮助的友好之情)
- How easy this recipe is to follow! (感叹式强调了食谱的易学易做性)

另一方面，"What" 感叹句通常强调一个具体的事物或情况。例如：

- What a beautiful day! (感叹式强调了美好的天气)
- What a mess this room is! (感叹式强调了房间的混乱程度)
- What a surprise to see you here! (感叹式强调了在这里遇见对方的意外感)

总的来说， "how" 与 "what" 感叹句都是表达强烈情感或感受的方式，但它们强调不同的语义内容。
on与over有什么区别？

"On" 和 "over" 都可以表示 "覆盖" 的意思，但在特定的语境下，它们有不同的用法和含义。

首先，"on" 表示两个物体或物体表面的接触或连续性，通常作为位置词或操作动词的附加词。例如：

- The book is on the table.（这本书在桌子上。）
- Please put the lid on the box.（请把盖子盖在盒子上。）
- The picture on the wall is beautiful.（墙上的画很漂亮。）

1. 用大数除以小数，得到余数，如果余数为零，则小数即为最大公因数。

3. 重复以上步骤，直到余数为零，此时上一步的除数即为最大公因数。

什么叫三元悖论？

三元悖论，又称三段论悖论，是一种逻辑悖论。它是由希腊哲学家欧几里德发明的，表述如下：

前提1：所有A都是B；

前提2：所有B都是C；

结论：所有A都是C。

这个结论在看起来似乎是正确的，但如果考虑到前提同时都正确的情况，这个结论实际上是错误的。因为在前提1中，A和B之间的联系是仅仅限于“是”，而没有“等于”，也就是说A并不等于B，B也并不等于A。同样，在前提2中，B和C之间仅仅限于“是”，其中并没有“等于”。结合前提1和前提2我们也会发现，B既是A的一种，同时也是C的一种，但并不是说A和C直接有联系。

三元悖论向我们说明了，在处理逻辑问题的时候，仅仅观察前提之间的表面联系是不够的，我们还需要更深入和理性的思考。

Title: Ecology in Russia: Challenges and Solutions

Introduction

Russia, the largest country in the world by landmass, is home to a stunningly diverse range of ecosystems, including the Arctic tundra, sprawling boreal forests, vast grassed steppes, and the world's deepest freshwater lake, Lake Baikal. However, the country is plagued by a variety of pressing ecological problems the Russian government and its citizens must address to preserve and protect its natural heritage. As a vital component of the global environment, the ecological health of Russia impacts the entire world. In this essay, we will examine the critical ecological challenges facing Russia and potential solutions to address these concerns.

Ecological Challenges in Russia

1. Air and Water Pollution

One of the most significant ecological problems in Russia is air and water pollution resulting from rapid industrialization and urbanization. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), air pollution levels in Russia often exceed safe thresholds, leading to severe consequences for human health and the environment. The primary sources of air pollution are the burning of fossil fuels, industrial emissions, and vehicle exhausts. Furthermore, surface water pollution, mainly caused by untreated sewage, agricultural runoff, and industrial waste, is widespread in the country, jeopardizing the quality of water resources.

2. Deforestation

Russia is home to the world's largest forest reserves, accounting for over 20% of the Earth's forests. However, illegal logging, forest fires, and agrarian activities are causing extensive deforestation, impacting air quality and releasing vast amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. This contributes to global climate change and endangers the habitats of countless plant and animal species native to Russia.

3. Endangered Species

Russia's rich biodiversity is under threat due to habitat destruction, poaching, and pollution. Some iconic species, such as the Siberian tiger, Far Eastern leopard, and Amur sturgeon, are on the brink of extinction. These endangered species play integral roles in maintaining ecological balance in Russia's ecosystems, and their decline will have grave consequences not just for Russia but the entire planet.

4. Climate Change

Russia's vulnerability to climate change cannot be overstated. The country's vast northern regions are experiencing rapid warming, causing permafrost thawing, coastal erosion, and extreme weather events. These changes threaten the stability of Russia's infrastructure, such as roads and buildings, disrupt traditional lifestyles of indigenous peoples, and contribute to the release of massive amounts of trapped methane, a greenhouse gas more potent than carbon dioxide.

Potential Solutions

1. Environmental Regulations

To address the various sources of pollution in Russia, the government must strengthen and enforce environmental regulations. This can include setting stringent emissions standards for industries and vehicles, implementing taxes on pollution, and investing in renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power. Moreover, proper treatment of sewage and industrial waste before discharge will go a long way in averting surface water pollution.

2. Sustainable Forest Management

Russia must embrace sustainable forest management practices to prevent deforestation and retain their vital role as carbon sinks. Measures such as reforestation programs, prevention of illegal logging, and controlled burning operations to minimize the risk of wildfires can substantially reduce deforestation rates and protect biodiversity.

3. Wildlife Conservation

The Russian government should invest in wildlife conservation measures, such as establishing and maintaining protected areas, funding anti-poaching initiatives, and promoting breeding programs for endangered species. Public awareness campaigns highlighting the importance of wildlife protection can also advance conservation efforts.

4. International Cooperation

To tackle climate change, Russia must join international efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, investing in the Paris Agreement's objectives and adhering to its commitments. Sharing research and knowledge with other countries, supporting climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts in vulnerable regions, and investing in climate-resilient infrastructure will help alleviate the effects of climate change on Russia's environment and people.

Conclusion

As a globally significant country with an immense ecological influence, Russia must act urgently to address its environmental challenges. These environmental issues are not only detrimental to Russia's ecosystems and people but also adversely affect the entire world. By implementing responsible environmental policies and engaging in international cooperation, Russia can work towards a sustainable future and contribute to the global fight to protect our planet.

conversation.content:
Rewrite, 'Seeking efficiencies and streamlining operations, businesses have been turning to AI-based automation. As they pursue this, they need a way to look beyond their assumed processes to improve their actual processes. To achieve this goal, they are finding process mining a key strategy.
In its simplest form, automation may take the form of robotic process automation (RPA), a technology that has seen stunning growth. Another approach now gaining attention is hyperautomation, which Gartner describes as a business-driven, disciplined way to rapidly identify, vet and automate as many business and IT processes as possible.
But identifying which business processes to automate is not easy. Factors such as cognitive biases, inaccurate assumptions and a lack of detailed knowledge of ground operations can cloud decision-making and create obstacles to innovation.
What’s needed is a precise understanding of the performance of existing processes and how they operate. Process mining can provide this.
Process mining: An essential precursor to automation
Process mining is a methodology that uses event logs — digital records created by information systems and accumulated over time — to extract valuable information and actionable insights. By filtering, processing and organizing this data, it is possible to accurately capture each step of the processes involved and detect any deviations from their intended paths.
This allows organizations to precisely visualize business processes and their variations, and monitor them in real time. Through automated process discovery and mapping, organizations can achieve greatly improved optimization of workflows.
“Process mining plays a fundamental role in creating visibility and understanding before you automate, and it lays the groundwork for business operations resilience, which helps you alter operations in the face of changing business conditions,” Marc Kerremans, VP analyst at Gartner, told VentureBeat. 
He added that process mining is not only a fundamental part of creating visibility and understanding before you automate. Through its monitoring capabilities it also visualizes how different islands of automation are connected, and how they can be improved.
ADVERTISEMENT
From automation to hyperautomation
Hyperautomation is a comprehensive approach to process automation. It involves integrating various tools and technologies to enhance an organization’s ability to automate work. Process mining plays a critical role.
While RPA is the foundation of hyperautomation, its full potential can only be realized by pairing it with complementary solutions such as process mining, AI, analytics and other advanced tools. Enterprises achieve optimized efficiency when they automate more processes to extract insights useful to everyone involved in an organization’s digital transformation efforts.
ADVERTISEMENT
With effective process mining, analyzed data can further be combined with AI/ML to generate data-driven analytics that helps organizations discover the current state of their business processes and identify new opportunities for optimization and automation. Furthermore, process mining is an integral part of the multiple stages of the RPA lifecycle.
Initially, it is used to identify processes suitable for automation and analyze the extent to which RPA can be implemented in legacy processes and systems. Later in the process, it monitors and analyzes RPA performance to facilitate continuous improvement.
Process mining has emerged as a valuable driver of successful RPA initiatives. Its versatility in addressing the multiple stages of RPA implementation has proven particularly beneficial. Using process mining, organizations can identify potential areas for automation within their business processes and prioritize them based on their ROI potential.
ADVERTISEMENT
Gartner sees an evolution whereby advanced techniques such as root-cause analysis, predictive analysis and even prescriptive analysis incorporate AI for more detailed and extended insights into how processes behave and will behave.
“These advanced techniques also support operational decisions such as what cases to prioritize, what additional resources should be involved, and what tasks could be expedited,” said Kerremans. “The other way around, process mining creates a process model context to put the results of AI in a wider context that is more understandable for decision-makers in an organization.”
With process mining, enterprises can optimize both tech-driven and human-driven business processes, boosting operational efficiency and reducing costs. Process mining solutions can also enhance employee experience by streamlining resource allocation. Although process mining tools may be unfamiliar to some potential users, these tools are rapidly evolving and gaining increased functionality to cater to organizations with growing automation needs.
ADVERTISEMENT
Best practices for efficient process automation
For automation to succeed, underlying organizational challenges must be addressed, according to Jaclyn Rice Nelson, cofounder and CEO of data and AI consulting firm Tribe AI. Process automation requires effective change management, she said.
ADVERTISEMENT
“Change management has proved more challenging than the technical work required to automate the processes. The difference between companies that can navigate this change and companies that struggle comes down to the CEO and their commitment to automation,” Nelson told VentureBeat. “Leadership buy-in and alignment of team incentives to support automation are critical to the success of process mining and automation efforts. Without [buy-in and alignment], investments in process automation are doomed to fail.”
AI is essential to hyperautomation, as it empowers bots to undertake tasks that require reading, comprehending and processing data with greater intelligence. Furthermore, by incorporating cognitive technologies like machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), optical character recognition (OCR) and AI into RPA through process mining, organizations can significantly enhance process efficiency and accuracy.
“Despite the sci-fi-like advances in AI like ChatGPT, I believe some of the most valuable business applications from large language models will be from the next wave of process automation (RPA),” Nelson said. That’s because process mining often requires a massive lift on data aggregation, standardization and cleaning.
ADVERTISEMENT
With new AI tools parsing masses of unstructured data, opportunities will open for companies to automate their highly manual workflows. Nelson says these process improvements can greatly reduce costs, enabling companies to redeploy resources to higher-value business areas. 
“A food distribution company was losing market share due to a highly manual and siloed bid development process. Through our partnership at Tribe AI, we built an ML-driven system that mined and automated manual tasks and increased data utilization,” said Nelson. “Further, this upfront data work required for the process improvement meant they finally had access to their data in a centralized view that could be leveraged for business intelligence and high-value tasks like demand forecasting and price negotiation.” 
To measure the success of their process mining initiatives and what metrics they should be tracking, Nelson suggested CTOs and CIOs focus on time reduction, cost reduction and revenue lift.
ADVERTISEMENT
Likewise, Waseem Alshikh, co-founder and CTO of generative AI platform Writer, believes that organizations may face a challenge integrating various data sources into a single repository to capture the right data for process mining. They can overcome this by utilizing a data lake that can easily integrate data from various sources into a single repository. 
“Process mining can help organizations extract more value from hyperautomation by providing the insights they need to optimize their processes, streamline their operations and achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness,” Alshikh told VentureBeat. “Therefore, process mining initiatives should be carried out in collaboration with stakeholders from various departments, and their efforts should be integrated into the overall digital transformation plan.
“They should also ensure that the results of their process mining are being used to inform decisions and investments related to their digital transformation goals.”
What’s next for process mining for automation? 

Gartner’s Kerremans predicts that other critical use cases in an organization, such as process discovery and analysis and process comparisons for compliance, auditing, sustainability, business architecture and composability, will ultimately be automated through process mining. 
“Processes never live in isolation; they are interrelated. Process mining applies data science to discover, validate and improve workflows. By combining data mining and process analytics, organizations can mine log data from their information systems to understand the performance of their processes, revealing bottlenecks and other areas of improvement. Process mining leverages a data-driven approach to process optimization, allowing managers to remain objective in their decision-making around resource allocation for existing processes.

Information systems, such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools, provide an audit trail of processes with their respective log data. Process mining utilizes this data from IT systems to create a process model, or process graph. From here, the end-to-end process is examined, and the details of it and any variations are outlined. Specialized algorithms can also provide insight into the root causes of deviations from the norm. These algorithms and visualizations enable management to see if their processes are functioning as intended, and if they aren’t, they arm them with the information to justify and allocate the necessary resources to optimize them. They can also uncover opportunities to incorporate robotic process automation into processes, expediting any automation initiatives for a company.

Process mining focuses on different perspectives, such as control-flow, organizational, case, and time. While much of the work around process mining focuses on the sequence of activities—i.e. control-flow—the other perspectives also provide valuable information for management teams. Organizational perspectives can surface the various resources within a process, such as individual job roles or departments, and the time perspective can demonstrate bottlenecks by measuring the processing time of different events within a process.

In 2011, the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) published the Process Mining Manifesto (PDF, 9.6 MB) (link resides outside IBM) in an effort to advance the adoption of process mining to redesign business operations. While proponents of process mining, like the IEEE, promote its adoption, Gartner notes that market factors will also play a role in its acceleration. Digital transformation efforts will prompt more investigation around processes, subsequently increasing the adoption rate of new technologies, such as artificial intelligence, task automation, and hyperautomation. The pace of these organizational changes will also require businesses to apply operational resilience to adapt as well. As a result, enterprises will increasingly lean on process mining tools to achieve their business outcomes.



Types of process mining
Wil van der Aalst, a Dutch computer scientist and professor, is credited with much of the academic research around process mining. Both his research and the above-mentioned manifesto describe three types of process mining, which are discovery, conformance, and enhancement.

Discovery: Process discovery uses event log data to create a process model without outside influence. Under this classification, no previous process models would exist to inform the development of a new process model. This type of process mining is the most widely adopted.

Conformance: Conformance checking confirms if the intended process model is reflected in practice. This type of process mining compares a process description to an existing process model based on its event log data, identifying any deviations from the intended model.

Enhancement: This type of process mining has also been referred to as extension, organizational mining, or performance mining. In this class of process mining, additional information is used to improve an existing process model. For example, the output of conformance checking can assist in identifying bottlenecks within a process model, allowing managers to optimize an existing process.'

The IEEE published the Process Mining Manifesto advocating its adoption, while factors like digital transformation and hyperautomation will also drive market growth.

Enhancement, also known as extension or performance mining, utilizes additional information to improve existing process models, optimizing processes and addressing bottlenecks. Overall, process mining plays a critical role in achieving operational excellence and successful digital transformation efforts.

Hyperautomation combines traditional automation with innovative AI-related technologies like Machine Learning and Deep Learning and information systems automation tools like as BPM, iBPM, iPaaS, Low code/No code, and RPA. This comprehensive approach is of immense benefit and promotes empowered teams, enhanced decision-making, and improved compliance and risk control, particularly when applied to various domains such as customer relationship management, supply chain, and finance.

The IEEE published the Process Mining Manifesto advocating its adoption, while factors like digital transformation and hyperautomation will also drive market growth.

Three main types of process mining, credited to computer scientist Wil van der Aalst, include discovery, conformance, and enhancement. Discovery involves creating process models solely based on event log data, while conformance checks confirm if the intended process model matches the real-world execution. Enhancement, also known as extension or performance mining, utilizes additional information to improve existing process models, optimizing processes and addressing bottlenecks. Overall, process mining plays a critical role in achieving operational excellence and successful digital transformation efforts.

Process mining vs. data mining

While data mining employs various algorithms and methods to explore datasets, process mining analyzes event logs and process-related data to uncover processes. Gaining a thorough understanding of processes involves recognizing trends, patterns, and discrepancies in processes, visualizing actual process flows in detail, identifying automation opportunities, and discovering new ways to boost process efficiency.

How does process mining function?

Process mining tools extract actual process models from raw event logs. By obtaining event logs from each case and combining them, these tools reveal how processes perform in reality. 

The workings of process mining can be understood through the following steps:
Process mining tools integrate with several business systems of record (such as ERP and CRM systems) to gather event logs from the company’s systems.
The tools extract the sequence of activities for each case from the event logs.
At this stage, differences between cases become evident. These disparities arise due to manual adjustments or errors in the process.
After determining the activity sequence for each case, process mining tools begin to “merge” these sequences.
As variations occur, the real process will be more complex than the planned one. This outcome also allows the company to comprehend where its process deviated.

The versatility of process mining in addressing different stages of RPA implementation has proven beneficial. By using it, organizations can identify potential areas for automation within their business processes and prioritize them based on ROI potential. Moreover, process mining plays a critical role in hyperautomation, as it involves integrating various tools and technologies to enhance an organization’s ability to automate work. Data-driven analytics generated by combining analyzed data with AI/ML can help organizations discover new opportunities for optimization and automation.

Effective change management is essential for successful process automation, as well as obtaining leadership buy-in and aligning team incentives. Ultimately, process mining can help organizations extract more value from hyperautomation by providing the insights needed to optimize processes, streamline operations, and achieve greater efficiency and effectiveness.
